## Risk‑Free Combination and Sharpe Ratio ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(202) #| eval: true #| echo: false #| results: asis #| warning: false library(webexercises) rf <- rnorm(1, mean = 4, sd = 0.5) # risk‑free rate (%) ret_tan <- rnorm(1, mean = 12, sd = 2) # expected return of tangent portfolio (%) sd_tan <- rnorm(1, mean = 18, sd = 3) # volatility of tangent portfolio (%) w <- runif(1, 0, 1.5) # weight in tangent portfolio (allow >1 for leverage) ret_port <- w * ret_tan + (1 - w) * rf # expected return of combined portfolio sd_port <- abs(w) * sd_tan # standard deviation (risk‑free asset has zero volatility) risk_prem <- ret_port - rf # risk premium of combined portfolio sharpe <- ifelse(sd_port > 0, risk_prem / sd_port, NA) ``` ::: You build a portfolio by combining the risk‑free asset (rate = **3.43%**) with a tangent portfolio (expected return = **11.12%**, volatility = **16.99%**) using a weight of **29.77%** in the tangent portfolio (weights greater than 100% imply leverage). ::: {.question-block}
✅ Expected return = w×ret_tan + (1−w)×Rf = **5.72**%.
::: ::: {.question-block}
✅ Standard deviation = |w|×σ_tan = **5.06**%.
::: ::: {.question-block}
✅ Sharpe ratio = risk premium / volatility = **0.45**.
:::
